member.name: T:Custom.Candlestick
member.summary: Candlestick. A charting method, originally from Japan, in which the high and low are plotted as a single line and are referred to as shadows. The price range between the open and the close is plotted as a narrow rectangle and is referred to as the body. If the close is above the open, the body is white. If the close is below the open, the body is black.

member.name: M:Custom.Candlestick.Count(System.Number)
member.summary: width 'less or equal than' (n * BlockWidth + (n - 1) * MarginWidth)

member.name: F:Custom.CandlestickChart._highlight
member.summary: Highlight background for the area in the range.

member.name: F:Custom.CandlestickChart._leftBound
member.summary: Lower bound line delimiting the highlight (to the left)

member.name: F:Custom.CandlestickChart._rightBound
member.summary: Higher bound line delimiting the highlight (to the right)

member.name: F:Custom.CandlestickChartOptions.day
member.summary: The starting day. The date closer to today.

member.name: F:Custom.CandlestickChartOptions.count
member.summary: The number of days counting to the past.
